column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: North Dakota
column6: ND

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 2. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column6: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.
column8: reduce your following distance.
column10: always drive at the highest speed allowed.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed
column6: No trucks allowed
column8: Truck stop ahead

column2: 4. When passing a motorcycle, you must:
column4: honk your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column6: have your vehicle entirely into the left lane before and during the pass.
column8: speed up above the speed limit and use your emergency lights to alert the motorcyle that you are about to pass.

column2: 5. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column6: speed up.
column8: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column10: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.

column2: 6. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 7. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 8. If you arrive at an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as another vehicle:
column4: the car on the left has the right-of-way.
column6: any vehicle already in the intersection should yield to the car on the right.
column8: the car on the right should yield to the car on the left.
column10: the car on the left should yield to the car on the right.

column2: 9. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column8: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 10. When driving in fog:
column4: turn on your hazard lights.
column6: turn on your low beams.
column8: do not drive over 10 MPH.

column2: 11. If you see an animal on the road:
column4: honk your horn.
column6: be very cautious.
column8: pass the animal as fast as possible.

column2: 12. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: there is an intersection ahead.
column8: right turns are not allowed.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: No U-Turn
column6: Slippery when wet
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 14. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the right side of the road.
column6: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 15. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 16. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must stop immediately.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 17. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 18. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column6: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.

column2: 19. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: Intersection ahead.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 21. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.
column6: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column8: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.

column2: 22. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 23. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: Never.
column6: As long as you don’t drive.
column8: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.
column10: Only if you ride in the back seat.

column2: 24. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Come to a full stop
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Proceed with caution

column2: 25. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: not turn right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.
